page.title: 04The Church Part 2
page.content: In 1910 the church was modernised and the pulpit was moved to its present position. The oak from the old pews was used to line the{chancel.}A door which was in the south wall has been infilled and a new door opened in the west wall under the{bell tower.}The {manse,}which is now a private dwelling called 'Mansfield',was originally the home of the{ministers.}The manse was a {Georgian}building before it was enlarged and reconstructed in the 19th century.The church continues but the minister now lives in the{manse}at Tealing as the parishes of Auchterhouse, Tealing and Murroes are now linked and have only one minister, the{Rev. Mrs. Johnstone,}where there used to be three. Today it is easier for the minister to visit by car the three parishes than it would be to walk round one parish.
